headline: Beef and Cabbage Stew
description: A beef and cabbage stew recipe that is well worth the time. Beef, cabbage, and potatoes are simmered in a tomato-based broth for a hearty meal.
name: Beef and Cabbage Stew
recipeIngredient: 1.5 pounds beef stew meat, cut into 1-inch pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Cook and stir stew meat in a large saucepan or Dutch oven over medium heat until browned on all sides, 10 to 15 minutes. Drain any excess grease.
Stir beef bouillon into beef broth in a bowl until dissolved; pour over stew meat. Add onion, black pepper, and bay leaf; cover and simmer until stew meat is very tender, at least 2 hours.
Add cabbage, potatoes, celery, and carrot; cover and simmer until potatoes are tender, 30 to 45 more minutes.
Stir tomato sauce and salt into the stew; simmer, uncovered, until tomato sauce is fully incorporated and flavors have blended, 15 to 20 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I seasoned differently then recipe and i coated meat in seasoned flour but this was a hit!!! Such a good recipe! The hint of tomato sauce was perfect. Thank you for sharing
Outstanding!! I added red wine . It was a horrible winter day, raw, wet and this dish was a rare treat. I’ll be making this beef cabbage stew again.

Excellent! Since I'm into health & fitness and gaining lean body mass while trimming body fat, I added more meat and less potatoes, etc. so not as many calories (which turn to fat) and more protein. SLM = Stew Lives Matter
My whole family loved this. I did coat the beef in seasoned flour before brazing in butter. It was delicious!
This recipe is amazing, I use at least 2lbs. of beef and add the tomato sauce at the same time as the vegetables . Our family loves this stew. Thanks.
It was tasty but was lacking something. My second try, I added a bunch of garlic, worcestershire sauce, and used a can of tomato basil soup, instead of the tomato sauce.

As someone who grew up loving cabbage soup, this recipe is to die for!!! It’s a flavor blasted version of the cabbage soup i grew to love! Not only is it a healthy hearty meal, but this recipe could feed a household of two for 3-4 days! I actually took the advice from another user, Kelly, and used the diced tomatoes and tomato paste instead of tomato sauce! I personally decided to double all the veggies and it ended up delicious!
Fantastic! Don't be afraid to use more cabbage, carrots, etc., just add more broth. It is phenomenal.
Turned out great. Great stew for a cold night.
Delish! I used a cup of pearl barley instead of potatoes. No salt but used roasted garlic flavored Hunts tomato sauce.

Delicious! When I added the veggies it seemed like there wasn’t enough liquid so I added more beef broth. In retrospect this probably wasn’t necessary. I’ll definitely make this again, it’s easy and sooooo good!!
It was a great recipe. I did add rutabaga parsnip a small can of tomato paste and a cup of wine. Followed directions and it was delicious.
One of the few recipes from this site that I made as written. Easy and very good. The fam loved it. Thanks for posting.
A very delicious stew. We served this over rice which made it very good. Will make again.
Was great made with GB, no carrot, lot less speghetti sauce, Maggie's, Chacheres, used 3/4 head of small cabbage, ate with fresh french bread!

Delicious! Made as written, except that I poured everything in the slow cooker after browning the meat and starting the veggies then cooked for 5 hours on low. Hubby was skeptical at first glance. When the house started to smell great, he kept asking when dinner would be ready. Definitely a keeper!
I made this today and it turned out really well! I just threw it all (raw meat included) in the crockpot for about 8 hours on low. I did not brown the meat. We really enjoyed it!
excellent dinner

CONT. I also added about 1/2 tablespoon of sugar, as others had mentioned, to mellow out the tang of the tomato sauce. But if I had been able to add the cabbage, it might not have needed the sugar. I was really bummed about being out of cabbage. How can a Hungarian LIVE without a regular dose of cabbage (or sour cream for that matter. Four stars only because this was not a knockout dish - very good but just not 5 stars.

I made some changes because I am a free spirit. I put my spices into some flour and dredged the beef. I then used some oil to brown my meat. I used 4 boullion cubes because I didn't have beef broth. I added the tomato sauce when I added the water, celery and onions to the mix. My husband loved it. I am leaving the tomato sauce out next time because I don't care for it.
Took over 3 hours to make and the flavor was “just ok.” Pretty disappointed in the results. I will look for another stew recipe next time.
Didn’t change a thing. Perfect as is!

Wow this is delicious and so simple! It is time consuming, but largely unattended. I did have to add water 6-8 times during the cooking of the meat, but it came out AMAZING! Even BETTER the next day. This is definitely a keeper! Thank you!
Will be making it in the slow cooker next time though
My first time every making stew. Tried this one and doubled it. It was fantastic.

This was super easy to make and the meat was tender and perfect, however it was a little too sweet for our tastes. I doubled the broth and bouillon, added soy sauce and more pepper and it was perfect! I will definitely make this again and maybe add some peas next time.
No changes on the first shot. The next time I will do some changes in the spices. I prefer things a bit spicier.

This recipe it is excellent. I made it for my family one day and I turned around had to double the recipe because it seem like it’s just wasn’t enough. The only slight change I made is when I browned the beef I added a touch of basil and a pinch of salt. I definitely will make this again and again.

Great recipe. I incorporated a few changes but tried to limit them to keep true to the original recipe. I dusted the beef cubes with seasoned flour before browning them to help thicken the broth. I substituted brussel sprouts that I quartered instead of shredded cabbage and added mushrooms. Very hearty and delicious. Thanks for sharing.

It was a delicious, easy and a nice upgrade to my usual beef stew. I loved the addition of the cabbage . 
I did toss my stew meat in a small amount of cornstarch before browning. The consistency was perfect to lie liking.

So good! I followed the recipe exactly with the exception of the added salt at the end. As at least one other reviewer noted, I was concerned I didn’t have nearly enough liquid after adding the cabbage and veggies and cooking for 30 mins. More time and even more time with the tomato paste saved things without me adding more liquid.
Added fresh parsley and 15 ounce of tomato sauce.
Delicious!!

I loved this recipe. I omitted the potatoes because my husband is going low carb. Wanted to make it more of a soup then a stew so added extra beef broth, carrots and celery. 
I threw in a package of beefy onion soup mix to give it extra flavor and sprinkled in some garlic salt. The end result was exactly as I wanted.
This one is going into my regular rotation of meals. Excellent flavor!!
So it wasn’t as flavorful as we like but that being said the meat was absolutely perfect! We never get our stew meat this tender
I added fresh garlic and Worcestershire sauce to the broth and at end did whole 15 oz can of tomato sauce. Was delicious.

Followed the recipe exactly as written and was very disappointed with the results. There is not enough liquid in the recipe, and after you cook each step as long as it says the beef turns into mush. While I appreciate the health benefits of cabbage, if I ever made this again I would leave it out completely add more stock, and eat a salad on the side. The cabbage makes the stew akin to the old vegetable soup diet.
This is an excellent recipe. I followed the recipe and turned out delicious. Very flavorful.

It was delicious!! The only additions that I made was a sprinkle of red pepper, 2 tablespoons of tiger sauce, 16 oz total of tomato sauce and a little extra beef broth in the beginning. It was so flavorable and delish!!! I would also like to add that the time can be condensed a bit by putting the celery, potatoes and carrots in earlier so that the beef can tenderize at the same time that the celery, potatoes and carrots tenderize. There is no need to do each separately.
Yes. I added fire roasted tomatoes, garlic, mushrooms, thyme, and rosemary. It's good either way.

I made this stew and loved it. I just didn't add tomato paste because it normally does have an overpowering taste. I just diced up 2 tomatoes and included it. Overall it was good and what I felt like eating on this rainy Saturday evening.
this was a very good recipe an easy to make
I agree its a little time consuming BUT well worth it. Only changes were one extra carrot and used almost 4 cups bone broth due to it simmering and cooking down. Excellent!!!
I used purple cabbage looked awful but tasted great. I had to use up the leftover purple cabbage from a different recipe. Lol!
Simply the best ive tasted
Absolutely the BEST stew recipe that I have made. It was a hit. I added more vegetable, therefore adjusted the broth and bouillon. Otherwise made as stated.

I actually made a lot of modifications. I had to add extra water and broth. I added corn starch to thicken it. I added peas. And I also added parsley, onion powder, garlic powder and celery salt. And I did not add the tomato sauce. I like it.

It is soooo yummy ! I seared the meat, and when the last batch was done, I scraped up the brown bits with some of the stock - cooked it low & slow till the meat was tender - I doubled the potatoes & carrots - left out the celery ( not a fan of the flavor of cooked celery ) I did S & P for each step No slurry needed, the starchy potatoes did the job

I made a combination between this recipe and another one. It was delicious! I took the advice from someone else who altered the recipe and added 1 TBSP of A-1 and Worcestershire sauce. From my go to seasonings I added Oregano, Turmeric ,Kosher salt and Creole seasoning to give it a kick! Results one happy family, even my pickiest eater ate it all. A great way to get my children to eat cabbage which I love but they do not.
I increased the amount of liquids and veggies adding, turnip, mushrooms more carrots, celery, potato and onion as well as the stew meat. So so good! My husband LOVED it!

It was a hit with the whole family! Even my 3 year old who's a very picky eater ate every bit I put in his bowl and wanted more! The only change I made was added in 1 cup of veggie broth mixed with 1 tbsp. of cornstarch (just to thicken it up a bit). But all in all this will be a dish I will be making again!
Very good!! Made per directions only added a little more broth & was quite pleased.
Very tasty and low in fat.
It was awesome and so worth it!!!!
Quite a hit with my family,i added half a cup of more broth,and added two tablespoons of homemade chilli oil into the half cup and let it simmer.nice warm touch but not overpowering spiciness.
I doubled the recipe. Turned out great. My wife said I could have drained more grease off on he browning the meat step. Other wise tasted great. Ill do it again.
My husband said this was a keeper. I added one additional potato and a couple extra carrots. No added salt. I used “Better Than Bouillon”. I will make again.
We loved it! We will make again. Adding the jalapeño as mentioned. In a comment is a nice touch.
i made it and it turned out GREAT.

This is probably the best beef stew I've made in a long time. My other half rave d about it and wished it made more. We were a bit Leary of the cabbage, but I followed the recipe to the T and we were pleasantly surprised. It's a keeper!

I made it as directed. It was easy and delicious. Except I did use 3 carrots instead of 1, and 1.5 lbs baby gold potatoes cubed. I had to add a little more liquid when I added the veggies. I liked that I could get the meat and onions in and cooking then take my time getting veggies prepped. Meat was tender and flavor was excellent. I was happy with the dish. It was as good or better the next day. Thank you for submission!

I did it all in a crockpot using ground celery seed and dried onion flakes in place of fresh. Left out the tomato sauce (personal preference).Thickened broth with Wondra Flour when done. Simple, easy and delicious.
Excellent recipe will definitely make this one again.
such a great recipe. thank you for sharing.
Goodness, this stew was amazing! I added extra vegetables and more broth.
Just like grandma used to make, this is easy and flavorful.
Followed the recipe exactly. It was great on a cold winter day!
Followed the recipe exactly. It was great on a cold winter day!
I made this in my crock pot, it was delicious!
Delicious! Followed the recipe exactly - but added a little red wine as it needed a bit more liquid when incorporating the veggies, and a dash of cayenne pepper for a little zip. Excellent!
Did not use as much tomato sauce as directed and added a punch of sugar to it. Worked out very well...used this recipe to use up cabbage in the fridge. Was tasty enough that I had no leftovers!
It is an excellent recipe that I will use again and again this fall and winter! My husband was very happy with the stew.
My husband and I loved it. I didn’t tell him there was cabbage in it. He says he doesn’t like cabbage, but he loved this. Couldn’t tell it was cabbage.
Great recipe I make as is, with no onion. I make simple spanish rice to go with it. I place a spoon full of rice in a bowl then add soup on top. Very delicious.
I did not have any tomato sauce so I added some ketsup. I also added a cup of red wine and it smells amazing!!!!
Love this recipe! Did not have enough of the beef broth so I added a can of "Yes" Beef and Lentil Soup with a can of water. My husband loved it!
Everyone had seconds !
Perfect recipe and makes enough for lots of leftovers.

I cut back on the meat and only put one potato (to cut down on the starch), then put in more cabbage and a little more beef broth. Simmered it for at least 1/2 hour longer for nice tender beef. It was really good. Next time I think I'll cut out the bouillon cube to cut back on the salt.

This was delicious! Made as directed except I added 3 cloves of garlic with the onion. I only had red cabbage. So, I used that and it was still yummmmy! I did have to thicken it so we could put it in mashed potato bowls. The whole family and 2 guests ate it up!
very average, will not make again. but healthy :)
This had great flavor and I loved the addition of the cabbage. This is a yummy beef stew :)
It turned out great. My entire house smelled delicious.
Turned out really good but needed a kick so I added garlic and chili flakes.
This is a wonderful stew! It was devoured by my husband, which is a good sign of what a great recipe this is.
I made this recipe today and it was wonderful. My husband wants me to make it again thus Friday to take to a family gathering.
Very good. Be careful not to add too much tomato sauce or it takes over the flavor.
Exactly what I needed while I was sick. Browned the meat, carmalized the onions, scraped the brown bits off the pan then put it all in the crockpot for the day.

My husband, who HATES stews, asked if I could make this again.

I made it in our Instapot. Pressed the "meat" option after each addition and pressure cooked it multiple times. Melt-in-your-mouth tastiness.

oh my goodness!
that is one delicious stew. 
I changed 3 items. I added garlic, cooked the meat in red wine & did not add celery.
next time I'll have to double the batch.

Followed the recipe and added garlic when browing the beef, a couple tablespoons of steak sauce when simmering and a can of cut green beans at the end. Made it for company and they all wanted the recipe, good indication of how delicious this was. Definitely a "go to" recipe.
I added garlic, corn and peas. Loved it
Added extra beef broth when I added the veggies - so delicious and easy!

Love this stew! The only things I changed, because of personal preferences, were I exchanged celery seed for the chopped celery, added peas and more carrots, cooked it in a crockpot all day, and added a thickener just before serving. I doubled the recipe because I know my husband was going to love it as well. It's a keeper!
DIDN'T CHANGE A THING. GREAT TWIST ON BEEF STEW!
Added 1 med rutabaga and a extra carrot
I love it. I added more carrots celery and potatoes. But it is very tasty. More spicy than what I expect. But very hearty and delicious.

DH says this was the best stew I have made. Of course, I changed some things. For those of you who think it is wrong to rate when you've changed a recipe, I ask you - is this a contest with a grading system? Or, are we helping others with our tried and true changes -take em or leave them? Anyway-Used, 3 bouillon cubes with 2 cups of water in place of broth and bouillon, more than 2 potatoes, hands full of baby carrots, 15 oz can tomato sauce, a splash of Worcestershire sauce, can of cream of chicken soup, and sprinkled a packet of beef gravy powder on beef before browning. Also, added portabellas, ground, to the mix! Yummy stuff - thanks for sharing
